RefParameter.Name: FrameBTAAcknowledgeEnable
RefParameter.Description: if set to Enable, the DSI Host to request an acknowledge response message from the peripheral at the end of each frame

RefParameter.Name: TXEscapeCkdiv
RefParameter.Description: TX Escape clock division The values 0 and 1 stop the TX_ESC clock generation

PossibleValue.Comment: Clock lane is not provided when time allows

RefParameter.Comment: Invert the HS signal on Clock Lanes
RefParameter.Name: INVERT_CLOCK_LANE_State

RefParameter.Name: INVERT_DATA_LANE0_State

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken by the D-PHY clock lane to go from LP to HS transmission
RefParameter.Name: ClockLaneLP2HSTime
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings
RefParameter.Description: LP2HS = TLPX_CLK + TCLK_PREPARE + TCLK_ZERO

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Maximum time taken by the D-PHY clock lane to go from LP to HS transmission
RefParameter.Name: ClockLaneLP2HSTime_ns
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken by the D-PHY clock lane to go from HS to LP transmission
RefParameter.Name: ClockLaneHS2LPTime
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings
RefParameter.Description:
HS2LP = TCLK_POST + TCLK_TRAIL + TCLK_EXIT
TCLK_TRAIL=60ns
TCLK_EXIT=100ns

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Maximum time taken by the D-PHY clock lane to go from HS to LP transmission
RefParameter.Name: ClockLaneHS2LPTime_ns
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken by the D-PHY data lane to go from HS to LP transmission
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneHS2LPTime
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings
RefParameter.Description: HS2LP = THS_TRAIL + THS_EXIT

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Maximum time taken by the D-PHY data lane to go from HS to LP transmission
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneHS2LPTime_ns
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken by the D-PHY data lane to go from LP to HS transmission
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneLP2HSTime
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings
RefParameter.Description: LP2HS = TLPX_DATA + THS_PREPARE + THS_ZERO

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Maximum time taken by the D-PHY data lane to go from LP to HS transmission
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneLP2HSTime_ns
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken to perform a read command
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneMaxReadTime
RefParameter.Description:
The MRD_TIME field is used in LP mode to determine if there is time to complete a read command in a BLLP period. MRD_TIME = Time to transmit the read command in LP mode + Time to enter and leave LPmode + Time to return the read data packet from the peripheral device.
MRD_TIME = (tHS2LP + tLP2HS + tread + 2tBTA) / lanebyteclkperiod.
Timings are expressed in ns.
tHS2LP = time to enter the LP mode.
tLP2HS = time to leave the LP mode.
tLPDT = D-PHY timing related to Escape mode entry, LPDT command, and Escape mode exit (according to the D-PHY specification, this value is always 11 bits in LP.
tlprd = Read command time in LP mode (64 * TX esc clock).
tread = Time to return the read data packet from the peripheral.
tBTA = time to perform a bus turnaround (D-PHY dependent).

RefParameter.Comment: Maximum time taken to perform a read command
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneMaxReadTime
RefParameter.Description:
The MRD_TIME field is used in HS to determine if there is time to complete a read command in a BLLP period.
MRD_TIME = Time to enter and leave LPmode + Time to return the read data packet from the peripheral device.
MRD_TIME = (tHS2LP + tLP2HS + tread + 2 x tBTA) / lanebyteclkperiod.
Timings are expressed in ns.
tHS2LP = time to enter the LP mode.
tLP2HS = time to leave the LP mode.
tread = Time to return the read data packet from the peripheral.
tBTA = time to perform a bus turnaround (D-PHY dependent).

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Maximum time taken to perform a read command
RefParameter.Name: DataLaneMaxReadTime_ns

RefParameter.Comment: Minimum wait period to request a HS transmission after the Stop state (min est 1 cycle de escape clock)
RefParameter.Name: StopWaitTime
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Comment: Resulting Minimum wait period to request a HS transmission after the Stop state (min est 1 cycle de escape clock)
RefParameter.Name: StopWaitTime_ns
RefParameter.Group: LP to HS and HS to LP Transitions Timings

RefParameter.Name: Mode
RefParameter.Description:
The Burst mode increases the probability of the link spending more time in low-power mode: the DSI output bandwidth should be higher than the LTDC input bandwidth in a relation that enables the link to go to low-power once per line.
The condition to use BURST mode is that the display device should support receiving a full pixel line in a single packet burst; if not use the Non Burst Mode

RefParameter.Name: PacketSize
RefParameter.Description:
The video packet size is limited by the size of the Pixel FIFO inside the display device.
For 18-bit not loosely packed data types, this number must be a multiple of 4

RefParameter.Name: PacketSize
RefParameter.Description: The entire active pixel line is transmitted in a single packet.The display device should support receiving a full pixel line in a single packet burst

RefParameter.Name: PacketSize
RefParameter.Description: The video packet size is limited by the size of the Pixel FIFO inside the display device.

RefParameter.Name: NumberOfChunks
RefParameter.Description:
The pixel line is divided into several chunks of Video Packet Size pixels .
If set to 0 or 1, the video line is transmitted in a single packet.
If set to 1, the packet is part of a chunk, so a null packet follows it if Null Packet SIZE > 0.
You must set the value to have Video Packet Size * Number of Chuncks = Number of Pixels per Line

RefParameter.Name: NumberOfChunks
RefParameter.Description:
The pixel line is divided into several chunks of Video Packet Size pixels .
If set to 0 or 1, the video line is transmitted in a single packet.
If set to 1, the packet is part of a chunk, so a null packet follows it if Null Packet SIZE > 0.
You must set the value to have Video Packet Size * Number of Chuncks = Number of Pixels per Line

RefParameter.Name: NullPacketSize
RefParameter.Description:
Each chunk is composed of Video Packet Size pixels followed by Null Packet Size in a way that LTDC interface input pixel ratio matches with the DSI output pixel ratio.
If Null Packet are allowed, the following equation has to be verified :
lanebyteclkperiod * Number_of_Chuncks (VideoPacketSize * bytes_per_pixel + 12 + NullPacketSize) / number_of_lanes = pixels_per_line * LTDC_Clock_period
If Null Packet are not allowed, the following equation has to be verified :
lanebyteclkperiod * Number_of_Chuncks (VideoPacketSize * bytes_per_pixel + 6) / number_of_lanes = pixels_per_line * LTDC_Clock_period

RefParameter.Comment: During HS Video Mode, Commands are Transmited in
RefParameter.Name: LPCommandEnable
RefParameter.Group: Transmission of Commands during HS Video Transmission Mode
RefParameter.Description: If the commands are sent in high-speed in Video mode, the DSI Host automatically determines the area where each command can be sent and no programming or calculation is required.

RefParameter.Comment: The size of the LP largest packet that can fit in a line during VSA, VBP and VFP regions
RefParameter.Name: LPLargestPacketSize
RefParameter.Group: Maximum Size allowed for Commands (except Read Command)
RefParameter.Description:
The LPSIZE field is compared directly with the size of the command to be transmitted to determine if there is time to transmit the command.
LPSIZE = (tL - (tH1 + tHS2LP + tLP2HS + tLPDT + 2 tESCCLK)) / (2.8.tESCCLK).
Timings are expressed in ns.
tL = line time.
tH1 = time of the HSA pulse for sync pulses mode or time to send the HSS packet, including EoTp.
tHS2LP = time to enter the LP mode. tLP2HS = time to leave the LP mode.
tLPDT = D-PHY timing related with Escape mode Entry, LPDT Command, and Escape Exit. According to the D-PHY specification, this value is always 11 bits in LP.
tESCCLK = escape clock period
the term 2 tESCCLK is a delay imposed by the DSI Host implementation.
The division by (2.8.tESCCLK) allows to expressed LPSIZE in number of Bytes transfered using the Escape Clock where 1 byte is transmitted every 2 cycles

RefParameter.Comment: The size of the LP largest packet that can fit in a line during VSA, VBP and VFP regions
RefParameter.Name: LPLargestPacketSize
RefParameter.Group: Maximum Size allowed for Commands (except Read Command)

RefParameter.Comment: The size of the LP largest packet that can fit in a line during VACT region
RefParameter.Name: LPVACTLargestPacketSize
RefParameter.Group: Maximum Size allowed for Commands (except Read Command)
RefParameter.Description:
The VLPSIZE field is compared directly with the size of the command to be transmitted to determine if there is time to transmit the command.
VLPSIZE = (tL - (tHSA + tHBP + tHACT + tHS2LP + tLP2HS + tLPDT + 2 tESCCLK))/(2 . 8 . tESCCLK).
Timings are expressed in ns.
tL = line time.
tHSA = time of the HSA pulse.
tHBP = time of Horizontal back porch.
tHACT = time of Video active. For Burst mode, the Video active is time compressed and is calculated as tHACT = (VPSIZE.Bytes_per_Pixel/Number_Lanes).tlanebyteclock
tlanebyteclock = lane byte clock period
tESCCLK = escape clock period
tHS2LP = time to enter the LP mode. tLP2HS = time to leave the LP mode.
tLPDT = D-PHY timing related with Escape mode Entry, LPDT Command, and Escape Exit. According to the D-PHY specification, this value is always 11 bits in LP.
The division by (2.8.tESCCLK) allows to expressed LPSIZE in number of Bytes transfered using the Escape Clock where 1 byte is transmitted every 2 cycles

RefParameter.Comment: The size of the LP largest packet that can fit in a line during VACT region
RefParameter.Name: LPVACTLargestPacketSize
RefParameter.Group: Maximum Size allowed for Commands (except Read Command)
RefParameter.Description:
The VLPSIZE field is compared directly with the size of the command to be transmitted to determine if there is time to transmit the command.
VLPSIZE = (tL - (tHSA + tHBP + tHACT + tHS2LP + tLP2HS + tLPDT + 2 tESCCLK))/(2 . 8 . tESCCLK).
Timings are expressed in ns.
tL = line time.
tHSA = time of the HSA pulse.
tHBP = time of Horizontal back porch.
tHACT = time of Video active.
tESCCLK = escape clock period
tHS2LP = time to enter the LP mode. tLP2HS = time to leave the LP mode.
tLPDT = D-PHY timing related with Escape mode Entry, LPDT Command, and Escape Exit. According to the D-PHY specification, this value is always 11 bits in LP.
The division by (2.8.tESCCLK) allows to expressed LPSIZE in number of Bytes transfered using the Escape Clock where 1 byte is transmitted every 2 cycles

RefParameter.Comment: The size of the LP largest packet that can fit in a line during VACT region
RefParameter.Name: LPVACTLargestPacketSize
RefParameter.Group: Maximum Size allowed for Commands (except Read Command)
